channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH

item.title: Report E-2025010163
item.description:
Report E-2025010163

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-13
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 13, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of methanol was damaged and released approximately 40-gallons to the trailer floor, asphalt beneath the trailer, and further migrated to a storm drain. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The crew overpacked the drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum. Absorbents and hand tools were used to remediate all impacted locations. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025010168
item.description:
Report E-2025010168

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-11
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it and the damaged pails into two (2) 10-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010167
item.description:
Report E-2025010167

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-11
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately thirty (30) gallons of material released from six (6) 5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010113
item.description:
Report E-2025010113

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: NORTH RIDGEVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) quarts of material released from eleven (11) 1-quart metal cans due to the cans falling off of the skid that resulted in the pails being damaged. The released material impacted the concrete dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010108
item.description:
Report E-2025010108

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 8, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was crushed and released approximately 40-gallons of product to the trailer and concrete beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove the paint. The damaged drum was overpacked in one (1) 95-gallon overpack and all was collected in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025010088
item.description:
Report E-2025010088

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-13
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 11:40 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal BCO. It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of Q1 Enzian Blue Satin Urethane released from one 5-gallon metal pale due to forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3115279. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Waste label 223391-1 was created, one 95-gallon poly drum containing one 5-gallon pale, oil dri, protective gloves, goggles, and plastic wrap. Chemtrec has been notified, report number 2024121300075 was given by Alex.

item.title: Report E-2025010090
item.description:
Report E-2025010090

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-12T03:40:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-11
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0828 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XAY. It was reported that approximately 27 gallons of Cardura E10P released from a 55-Gallon drum due to forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer # 3159845. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used (2) 95-gallon poly drums one for waste and the other as overpack of the punctured drum.
